intro: Bosqueia carvalhoana, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a small evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native habitat.
